DragUpload.dragDesc: Drag and drop files here to upload multiple images.
DragUpload.dragFileDesc: Drag and drop images and files here to upload multiple images and files.

actions.chunkingTooltip: Split the file into multiple text chunks and embedding them for semantic search and file dialogue.
actions.chunkingUnsupported: This file does not support chunking.
actions.confirmDelete: You are about to delete this file. Once deleted, it cannot be recovered. Please confirm your action.
actions.confirmDeleteMultiFiles: You are about to delete the selected {{count}} files. Once deleted, they cannot be recovered. Please confirm your action.
actions.confirmRemoveFromKnowledgeBase: You are about to remove the selected {{count}} files from the knowledge base. They will still be viewable in all files. Please confirm your action.

embeddingStatus.empty: Text chunks have not been fully embedded, which will render the semantic search feature unavailable. To improve search quality, please embedding the text chunks.
embeddingStatus.errorResult: Vectorization failed, please check and try again. Error detail:
embeddingStatus.processing: Text chunks are being embedded, please be patient.
embeddingStatus.success: All current text chunks have been embedded

status.errorResult: Chunking failed, please check and try again. Error detail:
status.processingTip: The server is splitting text chunks; closing the page will not affect the chunking progress.

featureTag.custom: Custom model, by default, supports both function call and visual recognition. Please verify the availability of the above capabilities based on actual situations.
featureTag.file: This model supports file upload for reading and recognition.
featureTag.tokens: This model supports up to {{tokens}} tokens in a single session.

ModelSelect.removed: The model is not in the list. It will be automatically removed if deselected.

ModelSwitchPanel.emptyModel: No enabled model. Please go to settings to enable.
ModelSwitchPanel.emptyProvider: No enabled providers. Please go to settings to enable one.
ModelSwitchPanel.title: Model

action.start: Installed and running, start the conversation

cors.description: Due to browser security restrictions, you need to configure cross-origin settings for Ollama to function properly.

linux.env: Add `Environment` under the [Service] section, and set the OLLAMA_ORIGINS environment variable:
linux.systemd: Edit the ollama service using systemd:

cors.macos: Please open the 'Terminal' application, paste the following command, and press Enter to run it.
cors.reboot: Please restart the Ollama service after the execution is complete.
cors.title: Configure Ollama for Cross-Origin Access
cors.windows: On Windows, click 'Control Panel' and go to edit system environment variables. Create a new environment variable named 'OLLAMA_ORIGINS' for your user account, with the value set to *, and click 'OK/Apply' to save.

install.description: Please ensure that you have started Ollama. If you haven't downloaded Ollama, please visit the official website to <1>download</1> it.
install.docker: If you prefer to use Docker, Ollama also provides an official Docker image, which you can pull using the following command:

linux.manual: Alternatively, you can refer to the <1>Linux Manual Installation Guide</1> for a manual installation.

install.title: Install and Start the Ollama Application Locally
